Module AppointmentSchedulerApp
Package me.stevensheaves.database.utils

Class CustomerDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.stevensheaves.database.utils.DataAccessObject<Customer>
      • me.stevensheaves.database.utils.CustomerDAO
  • public class CustomerDAO
extends DataAccessObject<Customer>
    This class follows the Data Access Object design pattern, and is used for retrieving all data from a database, that pertains to an Customer.

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> findAll()
        Finds all Customers, and returns them in an ObservableList
        Returns:
        Returns an ObservableList holding all Customers.

      • find

        public Customer find​(int id)
        Queries the "customers" table whose primary key: Customer_ID matches the supplied id.
        Specified by:
        find in class DataAccessObject<Customer>
        Parameters:
        id - The Customer_ID parameter in the database query.
        Returns:
        Returns the Customer object that corresponds to the specified Customer_ID.

      • findLast

        public Customer findLast()
        Finds and returns the last updated row in the appointment table.
        Returns:
        Returns an Customer data transfer object, representing the last row created in the "customers" table.

      • update

        public boolean update​(Customer dto)
        Updates the row in the database table "customers" whose primary key: Customer_ID matches the supplied dto's appointmentId.
        Specified by:
        update in class DataAccessObject<Customer>
        Parameters:
        dto - The Customer object which contains all data necessary to make the successful update.
        Returns:
        Returns true if update was successful, and false otherwise.

      • create

        public boolean create​(Customer dto)
        Creates row in the database table "customers".
        Specified by:
        create in class DataAccessObject<Customer>
        Parameters:
        dto - The Customer object which contains all data necessary to make the successful insertion.
        Returns:
        Returns true if insertion was successful, and false otherwise.
